name: JAXB
summary: an [[O/X mapping]] technology for [[Language:Java]]
description:
JAXB consists of the schema compiler [[Technology:xjc]] and a library that supports un-/marshaling. 
JAXB is typically used for [[schema-first mapping]] so that one generates Java classes and interfaces
from an XML schema (i.e., an element of the [[Language:XSD]] language.

name: JAXP

Strictly speaking, JAXP provides [[:Category:API implementation]]s.

name: JavaServer Faces
summary: [[Framework]] for web-based [[:Category:User interface|user interfaces]] with [[Technology:Java Enterprise Edition|Java EE]]
description: ''JavaServer Faces'' (JSF) is a standard [[Language:Java]] [[:Category:Web-application framework]] for the development of web-based [[:Category:User interface|user interfaces]] <cite>schalk2007javaserver, Wiki2011JSF</cite>. In terms of [[Pattern:Model View Controller|MVC]] it is focused on the View ([[Technology:JavaServer Pages]], [[Technology:Facelets]]) and the Controller ([[Technology:Java Beans]]). [[AJAX]] is included from version 2.0. ''JavaServer Faces'' controls the [[101feature:Interaction#Navigation|navigation]] between different pages and connects the pages to components implemented as [[Java Bean|Java Beans]].

name: xsd.exe
description: xsd.exe is a tool that generates XML schemas or [[CLR]] classes from XDR, XML, and XSD files, or from classes in a [[:Category:runtime]] assembly. The tool can be used in different reasons; one is for creating strongly typed DataSet objects; another is for [[O/X mapping]] (say, XML data binding).
